Crimes.Legal_Issue: Can the applicant's removal order be stayed based on the tri-partite test?
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant overstayed her visa; sought stay of removal based on husband's alleged refugee claim in Canada.
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Husband’s potential refugee claim and risk upon return
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Tri-partite test: serious issue to be tried, irreparable harm, balance of convenience
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Credibility of claims, risk of harm, public interest
Crimes.Applicable_Legislation: IRPA, sections related to removal and stay applications
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Application for judicial review and stay of removal
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Lack of credibility in applicant's claims
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Previous negative decisions by IRB, PRRA, and H&C processes
Crimes.Application_Basis: Humanitarian grounds linked to spouse's status
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: No new evidence of risk or refugee claim
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to prove credible risk of torture or serious issue
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicant sought delay due to husband's arrival and potential refugee claim
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Court relied on prior administrative decisions
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Lack of supporting documentation for husband’s claim
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Federal Court jurisdiction over stay applications
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Insufficient evidence to meet tri-partite test
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Applicant did not meet any prong of the tri-partite test
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: No credible evidence of risk or ongoing refugee process

Crimes.Violation_Type: Refusal of H&C application leading to removal
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Can the applicant's removal order be stayed based on the tri-partite test?
Crimes.Application_Facts: H&C application refused; applicant sought stay pending judicial review
Crimes.Claimant_Status: H&C applicant whose application was rejected
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Remained in Canada after H&C refusal
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Family ties, potential harm upon return to India
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Tri-partite test: serious issue, irreparable harm, balance of convenience
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Judicial review and stay application following H&C refusal
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Prior negative decisions, lack of new evidence
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: No new evidence of exceptional circumstances
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Stay of removal during judicial review
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to demonstrate irreparable harm or serious issue
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: No credible evidence of torture or persecution
Crimes.Cause_Description: H&C application rejected, leading to removal order
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: None directly violated; application refused under discretion
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Lack of corroborative evidence for hardship claims
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Federal Court authority to grant stays
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: No success on any element of tri-partite test
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: No new or compelling evidence presented

Crimes.Legal_Issue: Can the applicant's removal be stayed based on the tri-partite test?
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA), Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms
Crimes.Application_Facts: Refugee claim dismissed by IRB; applicant sought stay of removal
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Interim stay of removal pending appeal or reapplication
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Remained in Canada after refugee claim denial
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Risk of harm in India due to political or personal circumstances
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Found lacking by IRB and Federal Court
Crimes.Application_Basis: Fear of persecution upon return to India
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: No credible evidence of individualized risk
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Delay in removal until husband’s claim resolved
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: No proof of husband’s status or personal risk
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: No established risk of torture or cruel treatment
Crimes.Cause_Description: Seeking delay due to husband’s refugee process and fear of harm
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Reliance on finality of administrative decisions
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: None; lawful refusal of claim under IRPA
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Failure to meet burden under tri-partite test

Crimes.Violation_Type: PRRA refusal leading to enforceable removal order
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Can the applicant's removal be stayed based on the tri-partite test?
Crimes.Application_Facts: PRRA conducted and refused; applicant sought stay of removal
Crimes.Claimant_Status: PRRA applicant whose assessment was negative
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Remained in Canada after PRRA refusal
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged change in country conditions or personal risk in India
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Risk of torture, cruel treatment, or danger
Crimes.Evidence_Used: PRRA report, prior decisions, country condition reports
Crimes.Application_Basis: Persecution risk upon return to India
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: No material change in circumstances proven
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Suspension of removal pending further review
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: No new evidence of risk or changed conditions
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: No credible risk of 115 IRPA harm
Crimes.Cause_Description: Seeking delay due to husband’s arrival and alleged persecution risks
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: None; lawful exercise of discretion under IRPA
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Out of status after PRRA refusal
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Federal Court jurisdiction over stay requests
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Applicant failed all three parts of the tri-partite test
